Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Oral treatment with Memantine ( 10mg / kg ) and Ibuprofen ( 50 mg / kg ) daily for 13 days attenuated STZ induced glial activation , apoptotic cell death and post synaptic neurotoxicity in rat brain .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| STZ-induced glial activation |
| Apoptotic cell death |
| Post synaptic neurotoxicity |

In this paragraph, the diseases are "STZ-induced glial activation", "apoptotic cell death", and "post synaptic neurotoxicity". These entities were identified based on the context of the paragraph, which mentions that Memantine and Ibuprofen treatments attenuated these conditions in rats.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| STZ-induced glial activation |
| Apoptotic cell death |
| Post synaptic neurotoxicity |

In the given paragraph, "STZ-induced glial activation", "apoptotic cell death", and "post synaptic neurotoxicity" are clearly identified as diseases or conditions, as they are mentioned as the conditions that were attenuated by the oral treatment with Memantine and Ibuprofen. Other entities in the paragraph, such as "oral treatment", "Memantine", "Ibuprofen", "daily for 13 days", and "rat brain", do not refer to diseases and were not included in the table.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Oral treatment with Memantine ( 10mg / kg ) and Ibuprofen ( 50 mg / kg ) daily for 13 days attenuated STZ induced glial activation , apoptotic cell death and post synaptic neurotoxicity in rat brain .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Memantine |
| Ibuprofen |
| STZ (Streptozotocin) |

Explanation:
The given paragraph mentions two chemicals, Memantine and Ibuprofen, which are being used for oral treatment. Memantine is given at a dose of 10mg/kg and Ibuprofen at a dose of 50mg/kg. The third entity, STZ, is mentioned as the inducer of the conditions (glial activation, apoptotic cell death, and post synaptic neurotoxicity) in the rat brain. Therefore, STZ is also considered a chemical entity in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Memantine |
| Ibuprofen |
| Streptozotocin |

Explanation:
The given paragraph mentions three entities, Memantine, Ibuprofen, and Streptozotocin. Memantine and Ibuprofen are clearly identified as chemicals being used for treatment, and Streptozotocin is identified as the inducer of the conditions in the rat brain. Therefore, all three entities are chemical entities in this context.
